result.execSummary:
The defendant Brien K. Ackerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay a fine/costs/DNA Surcharge.
60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 
Any bond that has been posted will be first applied to payment of attorney fees, and then to the fine. 
Wage assignment will continue until attorney's fees have been paid. 
If Defendant wants wage assignment to continue for fines and costs, that will be fine.
No jail time. No conditional supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brien K. Ackerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brien K. Ackerman in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:53 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Count 1 Defendant will plead. State recommends an $800 fine.

Atty Hughes concurs.
Defense is free to argue on the fine but the State feels it is appropriate.

Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Hughes for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Failure to Comply with Sex Offender Program

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Hughes makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests a $100 fine plus costs.

BY THE COURT:
Pay a fine of $400 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
No jail time. No conditional supervision.
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Any bond that has been posted will be first applied to payment of attorney fees, and then to the fine.
Wage assignment will continue until attorney's fees have been paid. If Defendant wants wage assignment to continue for fines and costs, that will be fine.

Atty Hughes will submit his attorney bill by the end of the day.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:23 pm.
 Defendant Brien K. Ackerman in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Moleske calls witness, Sue Klemann, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Hughes.
Re-direct by DA Molepski.
No recross.
Atty Hughes gives final statements and requests dismissal.
DA Molepski gives final statements.
BTC:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

To be taken out of his current garnisment.  $50 towards bond and $50 towards the attorneys fees for each of the checks. 
Follow all rules and conditions of the registration and be in compliance with that.

Defendant Brien K. Ackerman in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Constable recommends a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Hughes makes arguments to the Court requesting a signature bond. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Granted - Repay at $100 per payperiod, M. Hughes appointed /s/ JVF 12/8/14
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: $100 every two weeks for Attorney fees

Defendant Brien K. Ackerman in court.  
3:31 p.m. case is called.
This is an indigency case.
The public defender's office turned the defender down.  
3:32 p.m.  Clerk swears in the defendant.
Court questions the defendant re:  wages and other income sources.    Defendant responds to the court.  
Court finds the defendant partially indigent.  Court states Defendant must sign a wage assignment to repay the county.  
Defendant states he could pay $100 every two weeks.
Defendant has an initial appearance next Monday at 1:30 p.m.  
Bailiff states no attorney available to speak with the court.

BTC:
Court asks defendant to stop in tomorrow and get the name of the attorney who will represent him.
Defendant to sign wage assignment at $100.00 per pay period.

3:37 p.m. case is concluded.
